# Block writing real secrets to .env files
input=$(cat)

content=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_input.content // ""')

  echo "[Hook] Detected patterns: sk-*, ghp_*, AKIA*, eyJ* (JWT)" >&2
  echo "[Hook] Use placeholder values or reference env vars from your secret manager" >&2
  exit 1
fi

# Warn if .env file is not in .gitignore
if [ -f .gitignore ]; then
  basename_env=$(basename "$file_path")
  if ! grep -qE "(\.env|$basename_env)" .gitignore 2>/dev/null; then
    echo "[Hook] WARNING: $basename_env may not be in .gitignore" >&2
    echo "[Hook] Ensure .env files are gitignored to prevent secret leaks" >&2
  fi
fi

echo "$input"

#!/bin/bash
# Warn about packages with many direct dependencies
input=$(cat)
cmd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_input.command // ""')

# Extract package names from the command
pkgs=$(echo "$cmd" | grep -oE '(npm install|pnpm add|yarn add)\s+(.+)' | sed -E 's/(npm install|pnpm add|yarn add)\s+//' | tr ' ' '\n' | grep -v '^-')

if [ -n "$pkgs" ]; then
  while IFS= read -r pkg; do
    [ -z "$pkg" ] && continue
    # Check if package exists in node_modules and count dependencies
    pkg_dir="node_modules/$pkg"
    if [ -d "$pkg_dir" ] && [ -f "$pkg_dir/package.json" ]; then
      dep_count=$(jq -r '[.dependencies // {} | keys[], .peerDependencies // {} | keys[]] | length' "$pkg_dir/package.json" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
      if [ "$dep_count" -gt 20 ]; then
        echo "[Hook] WARNING: $pkg has $dep_count direct dependencies" >&2
        echo "[Hook] Consider lighter alternatives to avoid dependency bloat" >&2
      fi
    fi
  done <<< "$pkgs"
fi

echo "$input"

PostToolUse.description: Warn about packages with excessive dependencies after install
